pros: Great environment that promotes active learning

pros: Ok place to work. Nice people for the most part
cons: Too much gossip about fellow employees. Expectations not clearly stated

pros:
Patient population

Some people may thrive better than others here. I would recommend asking lots of questions at your interview.  The person who interviewed me was honest and I appreciate that.
cons:
High productivity expectations

Inadequate staffing for 2-assist patients

Some patients are a 2-assist for transfers/gait/mobility, and it is up to you to find someone to assist when needed (this can be challenging as everyone else is also very busy). 

Interdisciplinary teamwork could be better

Productivity expectations assume a perfect day with zero interruptions or problems--it can be very challenging to make up time with a patient when you have no gaps in your schedule.  

I was reprimanded for things that were beyond my control 

There was a lot of negative chatter among employees; it was not a very positive atmosphere

review_title: Really great!  Everyone is pleasant and fun to work with.  The nurses are great and the office staff are very pleasant.
pros: Very pleasant work place.  Everyone is really nice and kind.  They are very easy going.  The work environment is very structured.  It is a great place to go and get experience in the health profession.  There have been very few patients that I have sat for that are difficult to take care of--something that is just the luck of the draw.
cons: Just given the nature of the job there can be a lot of sitting around at hours on end.  Sometimes family members come and when that happens you just go around and help the LNAs on rounds.

pros: The pay is decent. Extremely flexible hours.
cons: Hospital keeps taking money away from their employees to "cut back" expenses.  Severely understaffed on almost every shift! The staff who have been there for a long time are very lazy and seem to have more privileges than others. When lights go off for a long time instead of answering it a nurse or supervisor will track you down, even if you are busy. Nobody wants to help each other.

job_title: Licensed Nursing Assistant in Salem, NH
pros: Flexible hours. That is really the only good thing about this place. It works out great if you are a college student
cons: Management is horrible! The lack of teamwork makes the job a lot more difficult. A lot of the staff are miserable and look as if they don't enjoy their job. The absolute worst part about working here is the micromanaging from the RN's. They rather throw commands at you than actually work WITH you to take care of the patients.

pros: Great experience, I actually enjoy traveling when needed, it's nice as a change.
cons: There really aren't any cons, sometimes on weekends when your patient has visitors all day, you need to find things to do, answering call lights really is not something a sitter should do... Unfortunately my only complaint is the lazy lnas that hide in the breakroom while 1 lna is doing everything...

pros: Excellent perks, holiday, personal days, vacation time, benefits, pay was great, everyone was treated with respect, everyone worked together well. Great environment.
cons: Not enough work life balance, computers need to be updated,software was out of date, need to have a lot more team meetings.

review_title: Bunch of Morons and drama queens work here

cons: Never apply to work on this company.
